case_vignette: A 21-year-old woman presents to clinic with rough, firm spots on both earlobes that developed three months ago when she underwent ear piercings. She has tried over the counter hydrocortisone without any improvement.   She notes that she has a history of multiple similar spots that developed after she injured herself, and multiple family members have similar spots.   On physical exam, thick pink firm plaques are noted at the sites of ear piercings that extend beyond margin of the scar.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have rough, firm spots on both my earlobes that appeared after I got my ears pierced three months ago.
Have you noticed any other skin changes or rashes on your body?
Yes, I've had similar spots appear where I've injured myself before, and multiple family members have the same issue.
Have you been taking any medications or supplements recently?
I've tried using over-the-counter hydrocortisone cream, but it didn't make the spots better.
Have you noticed any itching or discharge from the spots?
No, I haven't mentioned any itching or discharge.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin's texture or color?
The spots are thick, pink, and firm.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin's texture or color?
The spots are thick, pink, and firm.
Final Diagnosis: Keloid.
